meanings.definition: Not changing or capable of being changed
meanings.sent1: The laws of physics have certain invariables that remain constant.
meanings.sent2: Her love for animals is invariables; it never wavers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's invariables curiosity led it to explore every corner of the house.
meanings.sent4: The invariables beauty of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The invariables truth is that hard work pays off in the end.

meanings.sent1: In the equation, the value of 'x' serves as an invariables.
meanings.sent2: The presence of supportive friends is an invariables in times of need.
meanings.sent3: The invariables of the recipe are the key ingredients that cannot be substituted.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like an invariables, brightening up even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The invariables of the situation was the unwavering loyalty of the dog.
